thread.title: NHL teams make fun of NBA Twitter guidelines, hilarity ensues
thread.title_full: NHL teams make fun of NBA Twitter guidelines, hilarity ensues

author: Gabrielle McMillen (gabrielle.McMillen@performgroup.com)
title: NHL teams make fun of NBA Twitter guidelines, hilarity ensues
text:
â Nashville Predators (@PredsNHL) February 13, 2017 
"Go Sports!" A little childish, but pretty funny. The Predators ended up coming back from a 3-1 deficit to win the game, 5-3. 
But the teasing continued as the Kings got involved, throwing a sassy barb at the Stars. @PredsNHL let's all have fun and have a good game toda...wait, wrong league we hope we win and you lose. because this is sports. â Dallas Stars (@DallasStars) February 12, 2017 . @SacramentoKings we're here for you if you need to vent â Dallas Stars (@DallasStars) February 13, 2017 
Since there is nothing in the NBA's memo that says a team can't mock organizations outside the NBA, it's really a nice offer by the Stars. But wait, the Kings had to get another sport involved. Remember when you guys were up 3-1? @Indians are there for you if you need to vent too đ https://t.co/Hqx4m0TPtv â Sacramento Kings (@SacramentoKings) February 13, 2017 
Oh no they didn't! Fear not, the Indians didn't take that jab lying down. . @SacramentoKings It's been 14 years since you had a lead in a playoff series. pic.twitter.com/regURNC7gd â Cleveland Indians (@Indians) February 13, 2017 
However, the Kings seemed ready for that barb, and clapped back with their own insult. â Sacramento Kings (@SacramentoKings) February 13, 2017 
How long before the NBA issues another memo that says basketball teams can't trash talk any organizations, period? Watch This
